item.title: If you’re an AT&T customer, your data has likely been stolen
item.dc:creator: Cody Corrall
item.description:
This week, AT&T confirmed it will begin notifying around 110 million AT&T customers about a data breach that allowed cybercriminals to steal the phone records of “nearly all” of its customers. The stolen data contains phone numbers and AT&T records of calls and text messages during a six-month period in 2022, the company says. If […]

item.title: Whistleblowers accuse OpenAI of ‘illegally restrictive’ NDAs
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
Whistleblowers have accused OpenAI of placing illegal restrictions on how employees can communicate with government regulators, according to a letter obtained by The Washington Post. Lawyers representing anonymous whistleblowers sent the letter to Securities and Exchange Commission Chair Gary Gensler. The letter refers to a separate, formal complaint asking the SEC to investigate OpenAI’s severance, […]

item.title: Meta removes special restrictions for Trump’s account ahead of 2024 elections
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Meta announced former President Donald Trump’s Facebook and Instagram accounts will no longer be subject to heightened suspension penalties, according to an updated blog post on Friday. The company says it made the decision to ensure all Presidential nominees were on equal footing on their platform ahead of the 2024 Presidential election. When Meta reinstated […]

item.title: Waymo cameras capture footage of person charged in alleged robotaxi tire slashings
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
A Castro Valley resident was charged Thursday for allegedly slashing the tires of 17 Waymo robotaxis in San Francisco between June 24 and June 26, according to the city’s district attorney. Prosecutors say the tire slashings were captured by cameras installed on the exterior of Waymo’s robotaxis. This is the latest incident of Waymo vandalism […]

item.title: A VC told Keely Cat-Wells to get a male, non-disabled co-founder — she balked, nabbed a $2M pre-seed round
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description:
Cat-Wells said she started this platform because traditional hiring processes are exclusionary and often overlook skilled, talented disabled people.

item.title: Experiment finds AI boosts creativity individually — but lowers it collectively
item.dc:creator: Devin Coldewey
item.description:
A new study examines whether AI could be an automated helpmeet in creative tasks, with mixed results: It appeared to help less naturally creative people write more original short stories — but dampened the creativity of the group as a whole. It’s a trade-off that may be increasingly common as AI tools impinge on creative […]

item.title: New Senate bill seeks to protect artists’ and journalists’ content from AI use
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
A bipartisan group of senators has introduced a new bill that seeks to protect artists, songwriters and journalists from having their content used to train AI models or generate AI content without their consent. The bill, called the Content Origin Protection and Integrity from Edited and Deepfaked Media Act (COPIED Act), also seeks to make […]

item.title: From Ethan Choi to Spencer Peterson, venture capitalists continue to play musical chairs

item.description:
When Keith Rabois announced he was leaving Founders Fund to return to Khosla Ventures in January, it came as a shock to many in the venture capital ecosystem — and not just because Rabois is a big name in the industry. It was surprising because unlike in many other fields, venture capitalists don’t traditionally move […]

item.description:
Archer Aviation and Southwest Airlines are teaming up to figure out what it will take to build out a network of electric air taxis at California airports. item.title: TechCrunch Minute: FTC finds ‘dark patterns’ in subscription apps
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
A new study from the Federal Trade Commission looks at the “dark patterns” that subscription apps and websites use to get more money or data from their users. “Dark pattern” is actually the term used in the FTC report, and it refers to manipulative design techniques that are supposed to make users do something they […]

item.title: SpaceX Falcon 9 suffers rare failure on orbit during Starlink deployment
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
The error brings to a close SpaceX’s incredible streak of 335 flawless launches across the company’s Falcon family of rockets, which also includes the more powerful Falcon Heavy.
